Portal is a great game. Portal 2 is greater. Single Player game is just great and so much fun, but the multiplayer is even better! If you can get a friend to play the multiplayer with you, do it, it's just perfect. Then you also get to play the levels made by other users and many of them are very well made. The community is still active and they keep rolling out a lot of interesting levels.

Well I already went on about my puzzle loving in my review for portal 1, 
but lets be honest no one is reading my reviews so I'm going to ramble on about it again...
Portal 2 has added a whole new adventure to it's previous Portal, the puzzles are more fun with the added benfit of paints and the 2 player option, I absolutely adore atlas, he's the cutest! 
And the best part? YOU get to make your own puzzles! I made one a very very simple puzzle that one friend solved in under 27 seconds in a way that I had not intended while another friend on the same puzzle gave up after 2 hours of trying to work it out. Portal 2 brings joy in so many different ways.
Let's not forget the ending song which is just as annoying as the first Portal's end song but still you find yourself unable to exit out until the song has ended just because you want to hear it.
God I love those ending songs!!

Portal 2 is the greatest way they could've continued the first game IMO. So much new stuff and new mechanics have been added, such as the 3 gels which are just extremely fun to screw around with and to find out how they all combine together, the tractor beams which are so satisfying to go in once you're getting closer to completing the puzzles, the lasers, the faith plates and light bridges. I won't go into too much detail on these new features, you can see for yourself. Glados is expanded upon so much more in this game, even becoming more human and more understanding of Chell along the way. In addition, there are two brand new main characters, Wheatley and Cave Johnson, who both share hilarious lines of dialogue. Overall, the singleplayer campaign is incredibly well fleshed out and just fun to stay along on the ride for.

Then there's co-op, which is an entirely different story. I guarantee this will be some of the most fun and most hatred you'll experience with any friend, perhaps even moreso than Mario Party. The stages are once again intricately designed satisfying-to-complete headscratchers, utilising the different elements introduced in the main story, but this time you and your friend are dependent on eachother in order to get through every level, be it you need to stand on the button in order to activate the tractor beam for your friend to get across, or you're being directed by your mate through his light bridge placements. Either it all flows perfectly or it's a complete clusterfrick and you're both trying your hardest to try and screw eachother over at any opportunity available. And unless you're both robots (which you are ingame but w/e), you're guaranteed the latter will be what happens. The constant switching between which player has ultimate power in each section and the perilous tasks you complete with them via pure trust makes the co-op in Portal 2 not only give you one hell of a powertrip when you're the one in control, but also puts you extremely on-edge whenever your friend is in control. It ends up being one of the most fun experiences you could ever have on a multiplayer game, and I thoroughly recommend at least trying it with one of your friends.

There's also a level creator for you to create your own puzzles and upload them onto the workshop, with tons of custom puzzles on the workshop for you to have a go at, most of them using an extended level editor tool called BEEMod allowing for music options, level themes, more items to choose from and probably more stuff that I'm forgetting. The creator is already very versatile as it is, and BEEMod just takes it to a whole other level. Lastly there's the robot enrichment store, with cosmetics, skins and taunts for you to use with P-Body or Atlas in co-op mode. Although the items aren't really as economically deep as, say, TF2 or CSGO items, as there's no community market and the only way to buy them is off the enrichment store for their base prices, they're still fun little bonuses for you to have and use on your co-op robots.

Overall, this is definitely a worthwhile puzzle game, and is worth way more than the £7.19 Valve are offering it for. Buy this whenever you can and get your friends to as well.

This game was good, but unfortunatly short, maybe it's just maybe thinking that but I don't know. It had many twists and turns, comedic moments, heartbreak, challenging puzzles, lovable characters, a great continuation, and overall some of the best voice actors to exist, play it and don't look up walkthroughs or watch anything with spoilers, why no walkthroughs? well you can do whatever you want but at the end of the game, the overwhelming happiness and proudity of yourself is great. No spoilers because this game is best played with no idea what will happen except how the mechanics of the game works. All in all, for something from 2011, this games graphics are up to date to even Battlefield 1. As my last sentence, I hope anyone reading this takes my advice, enjoy the game.

Прошёл 1 портал- мне понравилось, прошёл 2-й портал- мне оч. понравилось.
Сюжет: 9/10 в 1-ой игре было мало уровней, во 2-й это было исправленно (в лучшую сторону). Я подружился с гладос это очень круто (но огорчило, что она выдавала меньше сарказма). На конечной кат.сцене я сидел с улыбкой (типа: эх, это было крутое "дерьмо").
Атмосфера: 8,3/10 Я был напуган в те моменты, когда находился в заброшеных помещениях. Когда убегал от гладос чувствовал адреналин (на кончиках пальцев).
Музыка: нет оценки, т.к. её мало, но в конце мне понравился рофл.
Гемплей: 9,8/10 головоломки стали сложней, из-за этого на одном дыхании пройти (в первый раз) стало сложнее (т.к. залипаешь)
Я скажу игре: YES.

Basandomi solo sulla storia in single player devo dire che è un bellissimo gioco puzzle, con delle buone meccaniche persino nel 2017.

Pro:
- nuove meccaniche rispetto al primo episodio, ho trovato fantastici in particolare i liquidi
- il sarcasmo dei pochissimi personaggi
- migliorate la corsa e il salto, nel primo Portal saltare continuamente ti faceva andare più veloce della camminata
- sviluppo della trama interessante per quanto breve, il gioco dura solo 7-8 ore, ma penso che per un puzzle sia non male

Non avendo ancora giocato il multiplayer non posso confermare che il gioco non abbia punti deboli, ma per quanto riguarda la storia direi di no.
Forse per alcuni potrebbe risultare troppo semplice per l'agevolazione che il gioco offre alla morte del giocatore (se hai già completato ad esempio 2/3 del livello e muori, non dovrai rifare tutto, bensì respawnerai praticamente dov'eri poco prima di morire), ma secondo me lo renderebbe solo più frustrante.

Lo consiglio alle persone amanti dei giochi di logica e ancor più a chi ha poco tempo dato che dura poco.

I have played over 100 hours on this game. Why? Because portal 2 co-op with friends is a lot of fun, assuming your friends don't get irritated easily. The story mode is an excellent follow up too. A great sequel. Very impressed. 

Sometimes the co-op is frusterating, especially the gel levels, because things just suddenly work and you don't really know why. The game itself is a lot of fun and a great follow up to Portal 1. Then after that you can do co-op with your friends. Or you can do it with someone random which can be funny. Or give you a migraine. Story mode is pretty amazing and I was happy that even now after having this game for so long I STILL like to randomly do co-op with friends who haven't had a chance to do it yet, because it's fun. The story mode has a HUGE area for exploration as you get closer to the end, and you get a lot more backstory to what actually happened in Portal 1, giving the game a bit of depth. 

Also it's so much funnier than the first one. You got Gladus who *spoiler alert* is your potato buddy *end spoiler* then you have a fun robot friend with an aussie accent chatting with you. And some maps are huge. Some gels do some crazy stuff. Sometimes you beat a map and you have no idea how you did it, you just accidentally bounced around a lot and ended up at the end. I really like this game. Big fan. Replay value is very high.

Portal 2

'Nuff said.

The puzzles in this beloved follow up to the highly acclaimed Portal, are tougher and even more fun than before. The graphics are amped up, and the familiar gameplay will make quick work of this worthy title. It's Portal, what more can I say? Play it already!

Also check out the original, they are both great titles.

对我来说，Portal 2 是一款极品游戏（10/10）。
因为一下三点：
思考的乐趣！
解谜后获得的成就感！
发人深省的故事情节！

[h1] Obra Maestra [/h1]
Una de las obras maestras de Valve, sólo hace falta mirar su valoración. 
A diferencia de la primera parte, esta se centra bastante más en la historia, sin dejar de lado los puzzles, que se complican gradualmente gracias a nuevas características, pero nada que no se pueda resolver dándole un poco a la cabeza. Además de una gran historia para un jugador, tiene además un modo cooperativo perfecto para jugarlo con un amigo, pero esta parte del juego es exclusivamente para resolver los puzzles, no tiene algo que se pueda considerar como argumento más allá de hacer lo que te pidan. Pero es tan sumamente sublime que aún sumando estos dos modos de juego, se hace corto, y lo único que puedes hacer, más allá de volver a pasártelo, es crear mapas, o jugar los de la comunidad; es decir, juego de puzzles infinito.
Juego maravilloso, con gran historia (y mejor final, si se me permite añadir), con un modo cooperativo genial, y, al que además, le puedes sumar infinitas cámaras de prueba creadas por otros usuarios, y por si fuera poco, es prácticamente regalado en oferta para toda [i]la viciada[/i] que este juego conlleva.
Wheatley did nothing wrong!!
Otra joya de Valve , nada más que decir
good

Portal 2 — игра на один раз. Зато какой! Отточив перья и логику на первой части, Valve выпустила образцовый сиквел, к которому почти не придраться. Локации масштабнее и разнообразнее, графика — техничнее, повествование — глубже. Основа основ — по-прежнему пушка, создающая два взаимосвязанных портала, правда, механика стала гораздо сложнее.

Раньше мы просто дырявили поверхности, дабы миновать зону обстрела или притащить ящик в нужную точку. Теперь в уравнение добавлена целая охапка параметров. Лазерные лучи и кубические линзы, их преломляющие. Световые мостики для перемещения по воздуху или, если поставить их «ребром», защиты от охранных турелей. Пластина, подбрасывающая объекты. Гравитационные тоннели, которые подхватывают и медленно уносят все, что в них попадает. Три типа гелевой краски: синяя усиливает прыжок, оранжевая здорово ускоряет разбег, белая делает любую плоскость пригодной для открытия портала. (В раннем прототипе был четвертый оттенок, позволявший ходить по стенам и потолкам; его списали в утиль, когда тестеров начало подташнивать.)

Изменений — куча, только Valve не спешит вываливать их разом. Из главы в главу дизайнеры потихоньку переписывают правила, приучая мыслить новыми категориями. Уровни рассчитаны идеально: в меру хитрые, чтобы бросить вызов и растормошить серые клеточки, но без уклона в садизм. В худшем случае вы потратите 15-20 минут на поиски решения, стукнете кулаком о стол и почувствуете себя дураком — ибо ответ лежал перед глазами. В лучшем — порадуетесь, как быстро вы разгрызли еще один кусочек гранита. Portal 2 вообще благосклонна — для каждого многоходового пазла предусмотрены невидимые «чекпойнты»; если допустите фатальную ошибку в миллиметре от победы, вам не придется повторять все с нуля.

This game has an absurdity of puzzle mechanics. Portals, buttons, cubes, lazers, turrets I could go on but I don’t want to spoil every mechanic. They work very well together especially later in the game as the puzzles get harder and harder. 
Just keep in mind it’s worth looking at the puzzle from another angle if you’re stuck rather than insisting it’s one thing or the other. 
The game has a very smooth learning curve and a detailed story to match. The characters are fun and don’t take away from the puzzle solving experience. 
Wrapping your head around the mechanics can take a bit of time but it’s all the more satisfying once you do. The best puzzle game I know of by far.

A solid puzzle game which surpasses the original Portal in every way, shape and form. Honestly this game is really great even just to just figure out the puzzles but that's not what makes it great, It's the bigger picture that makes this game good. It has a lot of character to it that makes it so you won't forget about it as soon as you've completed the game. Not easy but also not particularly hard puzzles. I won't lie sometimes the puzzles had me stuck, but for the most part they're not that hard. That's not really a terrible thing, since you don't want to spend an hour on the same level, trying all sorts of possibilities to no avail. It's just supposed to be a fun casual game so if you want really hard levels, you'll probably have to look on the workshop where sky is the limit, so there really is a market for everyone. Some really well thought-out puzzles on there which can easily compete and even surpass Valve made puzzles

I say it's better than the first Portal because all-round it is. There's more story to it, way more actual content, more characters/character development, co-op and custom puzzles/maps. Portal 2 actually feels like a triple A game. Not only that, but because of the custom maps, you can get way, way more hours in this game than me since there really is an endless supply of creative puzzles on the workshop.
Co-op is double the fun, as you know every game is better with friends. Shorter than the solo campaign but it's still good all-round and provides a decent challenge - co-op also has workshop support so you're not done after completing the co-op campaign. It's a Source game so it should run well for 99% of people. Just gotta wait for Portal [spoiler]3[/spoiler]. But we all know [spoiler]Valve can't count to 3[/spoiler].

Olha, esse jogo é bom. Eu joguei ele muito (nem tanto), e eu ainda adoro jogar a campanha de novo e de novo. jogar com amigos é bem divertido, eu especialmente gosto de jogar Gelocity (um dos meus mapas favoritos da workshop). A engine do jogo é ótima mesmo em 2017, e ainda me impressiona, ao contrário de jogos mais recentes (SIMPLICIDADE, MAS CONTEÚDO). Eu, como teorista de Portal, adoro refazer o jogo inteiro (coop e sp) e tentar achar easter eggs. No geral, Portal 2 é legal, é bonito, é puzzle (e eu amo jogos de puzzle), tem uma boa e complexa história, bem divertida para teorizar e descobrir, todos os requerimentos para me fazer amar esse jogo pelo resto da minha vida.
